rows.story_text: One elephant is going to drink water.

story_text.eng: One elephant is going to drink water.

annotation_1.eng: Count together the elephants, the tusks, the feet, the eyes, and the tails.

annotation_2.eng: Which items are there the most of and which are there the least of?

annotation_3.eng: What do you think the elephant is about to do?

rows.annotation_1: Count together the elephants, the tusks, the feet, the eyes, and the tails.
rows.annotation_2: Which items are there the most of and which are there the least of?
rows.annotation_3: What do you think the elephant is about to do?

rows.story_text: Two giraffes are going to drink water.

story_text.eng: Two giraffes are going to drink water.

annotation_1.eng: Each giraffe has four feet. Count the number of giraffes and the number of feet.

annotation_2.eng: The giraffes are very tall. They must bend way down to get to the water.

annotation_3.eng: Two giraffes are one more animal than one elephant. What is one more animal than two animals?

rows.annotation_1: Each giraffe has four feet. Count the number of giraffes and the number of feet.
rows.annotation_2: The giraffes are very tall. They must bend way down to get to the water.
rows.annotation_3: Two giraffes are one more animal than one elephant. What is one more animal than two animals?

rows.story_text: Three buffaloes and four birds are also going to drink water.

story_text.eng: Three buffaloes and four birds are also going to drink water.

annotation_1.eng: Count together the buffaloes, the birds, the horns, and the tails.

annotation_2.eng: When there is one source of water, all the thirsty animals come to that one place. If a lion wants to hunt animals, this is a good place to find them!

annotation_3.eng: Three buffaloes is one less animal than four animals. What is one less animal than three animals?

rows.annotation_1: Count together the buffaloes, the birds, the horns, and the tails.
rows.annotation_2: When there is one source of water, all the thirsty animals come to that one place. If a lion wants to hunt animals, this is a good place to find them!
rows.annotation_3: Three buffaloes is one less animal than four animals. What is one less animal than three animals?

rows.story_text: Five antelopes and six warthogs are walking to the water.

story_text.eng: Five antelopes and six warthogs are walking to the water.

annotation_1.eng: Count the antelopes and the warthogs. How many of the warthogs are babies?

annotation_2.eng: Some of the antelopes are looking around rather than looking at each other. The pack stays safe by having some of them looking for danger!

annotation_3.eng: Of antelopes and warthogs, which are there more of and which are there less of?

rows.annotation_1: Count the antelopes and the warthogs. How many of the warthogs are babies?
rows.annotation_2: Some of the antelopes are looking around rather than looking at each other. The pack stays safe by having some of them looking for danger!
rows.annotation_3: Of antelopes and warthogs, which are there more of and which are there less of?

rows.story_text: Seven zebras are running to the water.

story_text.eng: Seven zebras are running to the water.

annotation_1.eng: Count the zebras and the trees.

annotation_2.eng: How can you tell that the zebras have been running? They must be very thirsty to be running to the water!

annotation_3.eng: Try counting the black stripes on some of the zebras. Do some zebras have more stripes than others?

rows.annotation_1: Count the zebras and the trees.
rows.annotation_2: How can you tell that the zebras have been running? They must be very thirsty to be running to the water!
rows.annotation_3: Try counting the black stripes on some of the zebras. Do some zebras have more stripes than others?

rows.story_text: Eight frogs and nine fish are swimming in the water.

story_text.eng: Eight frogs and nine fish are swimming in the water.

annotation_1.eng: Count together the frogs and the fish. Can you count that high?

annotation_2.eng: They are packed very tightly together. Do you think they feel crowded or do they like having the company?

annotation_3.eng: What is one more than eight frogs? What is one less than nine fish?

rows.annotation_1: Count together the frogs and the fish. Can you count that high?
rows.annotation_2: They are packed very tightly together. Do you think they feel crowded or do they like having the company?
rows.annotation_3: What is one more than eight frogs? What is one less than nine fish?

rows.story_text: How many different kinds of animals can you count?

story_text.eng: How many different kinds of animals can you count?

annotation_1.eng: One lion roars. He also wants to drink. Who is afraid of the lion?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the lions, warthogs, birds, zebras, antelopes, giraffes, water buffaloes, and elephants. That's a lot of counting!

annotation_3.eng: Most of the animals start to run away from the lion. Which animals will stay?

rows.annotation_1: One lion roars. He also wants to drink. Who is afraid of the lion?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the lions, warthogs, birds, zebras, antelopes, giraffes, water buffaloes, and elephants. That's a lot of counting!
rows.annotation_3: Most of the animals start to run away from the lion. Which animals will stay?

rows.story_text: One elephant is drinking water with the lion.

story_text.eng: One elephant is drinking water with the lion.

annotation_1.eng: The elephant, birds, fish, and frogs did not run away.

annotation_2.eng: Would you run away from a lion?

annotation_3.eng: Would it be fun to go for a swim in this watering hole?

rows.annotation_1: The elephant, birds, fish, and frogs did not run away.
rows.annotation_2: Would you run away from a lion?
rows.annotation_3: Would it be fun to go for a swim in this watering hole?
